p: The family Atelidae comprises the largest Neotropical NHP (5 to 15â€‰kg). They have a prehensile tail, are excellent brachiators, and feed mostly on flowers and fruits. The spider monkeys ( Ateles) and woolly monkeys ( Lagothrix) are distributed in the Amazon, while the muriquis ( Brachyteles) are observed in the Atlantic Forest. The howler monkeys ( Alouatta), recognized by their loud and characteristic vocalization, have slow locomotion and live in small tight groups. Ten species of Alouatta are widespread in the Amazon Basin, Atlantic Forest, Cerrado, Caatinga, Pantanal, and Pampa biomes [ 101, 102].
